alert.note: Alert for Chatham; Durham; Orange; Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 09 at 8:43PM EDT until July 09 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTHEASTERN CHATHAM, SOUTHERN DURHAM, SOUTHEASTERN ORANGE AND CENTRAL WAKE COUNTIES... At 843 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain has fallen since 630 PM. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area, mainly in eastern Wake county. Flash flooding is already occurring. While the heaviest rainfall has ended, high water remains on roads and flooding continues. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Law enforcement and the public reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Raleigh, Durham, Cary, Chapel Hill, Wake Forest, Carrboro, Zebulon, RDU International, Morrisville, Knightdale, Wendell, Rolesville, William B Umstead State Park, Falls Lake Boat Ramp, Rollingview Marina, Research Triangle, Falls Lake, Falls Lake State Rec Area, Bethesda and Gorman. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
